repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
This fixes #16632 by changing the drawing direction to LTR. This does basically the same as #19719.

The reception of #19719 looked quite positive but it was closed in favor of #19737, which was later closed because of other reasons.

Do people still feel the same way? @lewis6991 @clason

If yes, I would get this PR in a state where it's ready for review.

comment_data.body:
need to say a bit about the motivation, otherwise it just sounds random
```suggestion
• Signs are drawn from left to right, so the "highest priority" appear leftmost, while any signs exceeding the signcolumn width (thus not displayed) are the also the lowest priority.
```

also need to mention this in vim_diff.txt
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ DEFAULTS
 
 EDITOR
 
-• TODO
+• Signs are now drawn from left to right

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
• Signs are drawn from left to right, so the "highest priority" appear leftmost, while any signs exceeding the signcolumn width (thus not displayed) are also the lowest priority.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ DEFAULTS
 
 EDITOR
 
-• TODO
+• Signs are drawn from left to right, so the "highest priority" appear leftmost, while any signs exceeding the signcolumn width (thus not displayed) are the also the lowest priority.

comment_data.body:
A bit misleading, they were always "drawn" left to right, what changes here is the sort order. Also which signs are visible/not visible does not change. How about:

```suggestion
• The order in which signs are placed was changed. Higher priority signs will now appear left of lower priority signs.
```

What we already have in vim_diff.txt also does not seem like it needs to change; there is no order in Vim:

      'signcolumn'  supports up to 9 dynamic/fixed columns

Mentionioning the intention of the sort order somewhere `sign.txt` or at `:h signcolumn` seems more relevant.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ DEFAULTS
 
 EDITOR
 
-• TODO
+• Signs are drawn from left to right, so the "highest priority" appear leftmost, while any signs exceeding the signcolumn width (thus not displayed) are the also the lowest priority.

comment_data.body: There were indeed drawn from right to left before, but aligned to the left.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ DEFAULTS
 
 EDITOR
 
-• TODO
+• Signs are drawn from left to right, so the "highest priority" appear leftmost, while any signs exceeding the signcolumn width (thus not displayed) are the also the lowest priority.

comment_data.body: I mean it's a technical nit but my point is that what changes is the order of the placed signs, not the order in which signs are drawn.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ DEFAULTS
 
 EDITOR
 
-• TODO
+• Signs are drawn from left to right, so the "highest priority" appear leftmost, while any signs exceeding the signcolumn width (thus not displayed) are the also the lowest priority.

comment_data.body:
> Mentionioning the intention of the sort order somewhere `sign.txt` or at `:h signcolumn` in seems more relevant.

So should that go under `*sign-priority*` or maybe a new `*sign-order*` section?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ DEFAULTS
 
 EDITOR
 
-• TODO
+• Signs are drawn from left to right, so the "highest priority" appear leftmost, while any signs exceeding the signcolumn width (thus not displayed) are the also the lowest priority.

comment_data.body:
`*sign-priority*`seems fine to me, that text seems unadjusted for multi-width signcolumn anyways. Maybe update to something like this:

```diff
diff --git a/runtime/doc/sign.txt b/runtime/doc/sign.txt
index 0360ce67f..048f37023 100644
--- a/runtime/doc/sign.txt
+++ b/runtime/doc/sign.txt
@@ -72,9 +72,10 @@ on the same line, the attributes of the sign with the highest priority is used
 independently of the sign group. The default priority for a sign is 10. The
 priority is assigned at the time of placing a sign.
 
-When two signs with the same priority are present, and one has an icon or text
-in the signcolumn while the other has line highlighting, then both are
-displayed.
+When multiple signs that each have an icon or text are present, signs are
+ordered with increasing priority from left to right, up until the maximum
+width set in 'signcolumn'. Lower priority signs that do not fit are hidden.
+Highest priority signs with highlight attributes are always shown.
 
 When the line on which the sign is placed is deleted, the sign is removed along
 with it.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ DEFAULTS
 
 EDITOR
 
-• TODO
+• Signs are drawn from left to right, so the "highest priority" appear leftmost, while any signs exceeding the signcolumn width (thus not displayed) are the also the lowest priority.

comment_regular_data.body: I'm not against it in principle. We should maybe hold off until 0.10 is released.

> let's try it
> 
> did you analyze whether [#19719 (comment)](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/19719#issuecomment-1212849180) needs attention?

~Nope, seems like that doesn't work as expected. I'll take a look.~

Never mind I just made a typo, the following works as expected:
```lua
local ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace("reverse_diagnostic_sort")
vim.diagnostic.config({
  severity_sort = { reverse = true },
})
local diagnostics = {
    { lnum = 1, col = 1, end_col = 2, severity = vim.diagnostic.severity.ERROR },
    { lnum = 1, col = 2, end_col = 3, severity = vim.diagnostic.severity.WARN },
    { lnum = 1, col = 3, end_col = 4, severity = vim.diagnostic.severity.HINT },
}
vim.diagnostic.set(ns, 0, diagnostics, {})
```
![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/43008152/486622ec-8f1b-4fa2-bfd7-26b316e851c0)
![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/43008152/0f48b9da-d6ee-4f4b-9800-2eac60bf73e1)
